meanings.definition: A form of government in which power is concentrated in the hands of a single ruler.
meanings.sent1: In monocracies, one leader makes all the important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The history book discussed the rise and fall of various monocracies.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a cat ruling over all the other animals in a monocracies sounds like a funny story.
meanings.sent4: The CEO's control over the company was so absolute, it felt like a monocracies.
meanings.sent5: Living under a monocracies can feel suffocating, like having no voice in your own life.

meanings.definition: The rule or dominion of a single person or group.
meanings.sent1: The monocracies of the ancient pharaohs were legendary.
meanings.sent2: During wartime, temporary monocracies often emerge for quick decision-making.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a world where ice cream held the monocracies over all desserts!
meanings.sent4: Her influence in the community was so strong, it resembled a monocracies.
meanings.sent5: The monocracies of the wealthy elite can sometimes lead to social unrest.
